hypothesis.title: Improve Category Slider Clickability
hypothesis.description: Styling the category names in the image slider as clear, high-contrast buttons will encourage more users to explore product collections.
hypothesis.current_problem: The category names are simple text overlays on images, which may not be immediately perceived as clickable navigation elements.

variants.description: This variant transforms the category name text overlays within the image slider into visually distinct, solid rectangular buttons. Each button has a solid black background (#000000), features uppercase text in the brand's accent gold color (#f4a70e), and uses the 'Poppins' font. On hover, the button's background subtly shifts to a darker gray (#222222) and lifts upwards slightly with a smooth animation, enhancing interactivity.
variants.rationale: By converting simple text overlays into clear, high-contrast buttons, this design significantly improves visual affordance, making it immediately obvious that these are clickable elements. This change reduces user hesitation and directly guides them to explore product collections, addressing the core hypothesis that a stronger call-to-action will increase click-through rates.
variants.implementation_instructions: This code targets all category name headings within the image slider and transforms them into high-contrast buttons. It injects a CSS stylesheet into the page's <head> to apply the new styles. This method efficiently restyles all target elements, including their hover and focus states, to match the variant's design system values for a polished, professional appearance and improved user interaction.
